paper_abstract: We consider sequences of vectors from N-d. Each coordinate of a vector can be reset or incremented by 1 with respect to the same coordinate of the preceding vector. We give an example of non-dominating sequence, like in Dickson's Lemma, of length 2(2 theta(n)), what matches the previously known upper bound.
paper_title: Non-dominating Sequences of Vectors Using only Resets and Increments
